original_data.question: A 24-year-old woman comes to the physician because she had unprotected intercourse with her boyfriend the previous day. She has had regular menses since menarche at the age of 12. Her last menstrual period was 3 weeks ago. She has no history of serious illness but is allergic to certain jewelry and metal alloys. She takes no medications. A urine pregnancy test is negative. She does not wish to become pregnant until she finishes college in six months. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in management?

model_response:
The patient should be given a copper-containing intra-uterine device (IUD) as the most effective form of emergency contraception. Emergency contraception is indicated in this patient because she had unprotected intercourse and wishes to avoid pregnancy until she finishes college. The copper-containing IUD is the most effective form of emergency contraception and can be inserted up to 5 days after unprotected intercourse. It can be used as a regular method of birth control and can be inserted up to 2 weeks after the start of menses. Mifepristone and ulipristal acetate are effective for emergency contraception but are more expensive and not as widely available as the copper-containing IUD. Depot medroxyprogesterone acetate is not an effective form of emergency contraception.

Answer: OPTION A IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Individuals licensed to practice medicine.
Sexual intercourse without the use of precautions to prevent conception or the transmission of sexually transmitted diseases.
The sexual union of a male and a female, a term used for human only.
Occurring or done each day.
Deviations from the normal process; e.g. delayed, difficult, profuse, scanty, unusual bleeding, etc.
The first MENSTRUAL CYCLE marked by the initiation of MENSTRUATION.
How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.

The periodic shedding of the ENDOMETRIUM and associated menstrual bleeding in the MENSTRUAL CYCLE of humans and primates. Menstruation is due to the decline in circulating PROGESTERONE, and occurs at the late LUTEAL PHASE when LUTEOLYSIS of the CORPUS LUTEUM takes place.

The periodic shedding of the ENDOMETRIUM and associated menstrual bleeding in the MENSTRUAL CYCLE of humans and primates. Menstruation is due to the decline in circulating PROGESTERONE, and occurs at the late LUTEAL PHASE when LUTEOLYSIS of the CORPUS LUTEUM takes place.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
Record and study of past events.
A state of ill health, bodily malfunction, or discomfort.
Pertaining to, caused by, affected with or of the nature of allergy.
Objects of precious metal usually containing gems and worn to enhance personal appearance. Health concerns include possible contamination from lead content or bacteria.

Electropositive chemical elements characterized by ductility, malleability, luster, and conductance of heat and electricity. They can replace the hydrogen of an acid and form bases with hydroxyl radicals. (Grant & Hackh's Chemical Dictionary, 5th ed)
A mixture of metallic elements or compounds with other metallic or metalloid elements in varying proportions.

An absence finding of the specified component / analyte, organism or clinical sign based on the established threshold of the performed test or procedure.

\[Note: Negative does not necessarily imply the complete absence of the specified item.\]
This gene plays a role in stress fiber formation.
Observed to be or have been pregnant.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.
